sentences.english: Bowing is the simplest and most boring mechanical movement.
sentences.chinese: 拜，是最簡單不過，最枯燥不過的機械運動。

sentences.english: Me This journey is the most boring one.
sentences.chinese: 《我》我稱這段路爲“最枯燥的旅程”？

sentences.english: The job is boring, but we have to wade in right now.
sentences.chinese: 這個工作雖然很枯燥，但是我們必須立即說幹就幹。

sentences.english: Chemistry is so boring. It's hard to go to class when I have no incentive.
sentences.chinese: 化學課太枯燥了，沒有動力，去上課就很困難。

sentences.english: The office seems so dull and prosaic after Pine Ridge.
sentences.chinese: 從松嶺回來後，辦公室似乎變得枯燥無味了。

sentences.english: I mean this is so stupid and so insipid.
sentences.chinese: 我的意思是這是那麼的愚蠢和枯燥。

sentences.english: Counterparts, some say up several times to feel boring, want to change a mountain.
sentences.chinese: 同行中，有人說登了幾次就覺得枯燥了，想換個山登。

sentences.english: People at the convention heard many cut-and-dried speeches.
sentences.chinese: 人們在大會上聽到許多枯燥的講話。

sentences.english: I didin't feel tired and boring for the English study any longer.
sentences.chinese: 因此我學習英語時不再感到枯燥乏味了。

sentences.english: The meeting was so boring that nearly everyone there was watching the clock.
sentences.chinese: 會議很枯燥，差不多人人都看鐘希望快點散會。

sentences.english: As birds wax film and mouth is boring, shell base sheen.
sentences.chinese: 成鳥蠟膜及嘴殼基部較爲枯燥，無光澤。

sentences.english: Nothing special and even boring, right?
sentences.chinese: 沒有什麼特別的，甚至是枯燥乏味的，對嗎？

sentences.english: He made a very boring after-dinner speech.
sentences.chinese: 他在宴會後的講話很枯燥。

sentences.english: His dull speeches often underwhelm his audiences.
sentences.chinese: 他的枯燥的講話常常使聽衆感到膩味。

sentences.english: The lecture was so dull that many students dazed off.
sentences.chinese: 這個講痤極其枯燥，以至很多學生都瞅着了。

definition: bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
